item.title: Hermite Operators
item.description: Definition For an operator $A$, we denote its conjugate transpose as $A^{\dagger}$. An operator $A$ that satisfies $A = A^{\dagger}$ is called a Hermitian operator.

item.title: What is Dirac Notation?
item.description: Definition In quantum mechanics, a wave function is a vector and is fundamentally treated as a column vector. Column vectors are denoted by a right single arrow bracket, and this is called a ket vector. $$ \psi = \ket{\psi} = \begin{pmatrix} \psi_{1} \\ \psi_{2} \\ \vdots \\ \psi_{n} \end{pmatrix} $$ The conjugate transpose matrix of $\ket{\psi}$ is denoted by a left single arrow bracket and is called a bra vector.
